messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Two officers have been shot on 21st and Nelson.
All right, stay on the line. Officers have been notified and are on their way.
We have units coming down to 21st and Nelson. The officer's been shot there.
We're getting a signal from the vehicle now. Witnesses describe a suspect wearing Army pants and a black jacket.
Should we get anything ready at the hospital?
Yes, stand by. Everything should be there momentarily.
We just got a call about someone who shot himself in the head on 22nd Street between 20th and 19th Avenue.
Understood. We'll dispatch units to that location.
Someone already took the person to the hospital.
All right, are you going down with the officer?
Yes, we have a crime scene here, but no one is around.
Understood. Secure the area and wait for further assistance.
Man down over here. Need an exact location.
What's the address?
It's 90, 22nd Street. We need medical assistance.
Units are on their way. What is the suspect's description?
Black jacket, Army fatigue pants. Sounds like the same individual.
Affirmative. All units switch to channel 2. All communications redirected to Detective Bureau.
Can we get more personnel at the crime scene?
Take a count of uniforms at the scene. We may need additional personnel.
We have a large crime scene here. Additional uniforms needed.
I'll notify headquarters to send more units.
Update on the officer: shot in the head but not critical.
Received. Continue monitoring and provide updates.
Units, switch back to main channel for further instructions.
All units switch back to the main channel.
Do we have any information on the suspect's whereabouts?
No updates yet. Keep the area secure.
I'm going back to service from 22nd Street.
Understood. Follow up at the station if needed.
